item.title: Default Cut Scores for MAP Growth Reading and Mathematics Assessments
item.dc:creator: Taylor Riordan
item.description:
NWEA provides a linking study (historically called the “generic linking study”) for partners who do not currently have a state linking study. This linking study provides a research-backed and statistically

The post Default Cut Scores for MAP Growth Reading and Mathematics Assessments appeared first on NWEA.
item.content:encoded:
NWEA provides a linking study (historically called the “generic linking study”) for partners who do not currently have a state linking study. This linking study provides a research-backed and statistically sound method of projecting a student’s proficiency level using MAP Growth data. We now have an updated version of this linking study. The way we refer to the study is changing from “generic linking study” to “default linking study.” For more information, please visit NWEA Connection.

The post Default Cut Scores for MAP Growth Reading and Mathematics Assessments appeared first on NWEA.

item.title: Predicting Performance on the Smarter Balanced Summative Assessments based on NWEA MAP Growth Scores
item.dc:creator: Taylor Riordan
item.description:
To predict student achievement on the Smarter Balanced Assessment Consortium (SBAC) summative assessments in Grades 3–8 in English Language Arts/Literacy (ELA) and Mathematics, NWEA® conducted a linking study using Spring

The post Predicting Performance on the Smarter Balanced Summative Assessments based on NWEA MAP Growth Scores appeared first on NWEA.
item.content:encoded:
To predict student achievement on the Smarter Balanced Assessment Consortium (SBAC)
summative assessments in Grades 3–8 in English Language Arts/Literacy (ELA) and Mathematics,
NWEA® conducted a linking study using Spring 2019 data to derive Rasch Unit (RIT) cut scores on the MAP® Growth assessments that correspond to the SBAC achievement levels. Educators can use this valuable information to see where students are now, develop growth goals for the coming year, and create instructional strategies to meet them. This linking study has been updated since the previous version published in July 2017 to incorporate the new 2020 NWEA MAP Growth norms.

The post Predicting Performance on the Smarter Balanced Summative Assessments based on NWEA MAP Growth Scores appeared first on NWEA.
